Summary Note:
Ambre Laurène Simon and the RM were introduced at an art auction in Paris. They bonded over their appreciation for contemporary art and exchanged contact information to discuss potential collaborations.
With a career spanning nearly 26 years, Ambre Laurène Simon has established herself as a key player in the industry.
Looking for a private bank with a deep understanding of wealth management, she joined Julius Baer for its expertise.
Family Background: Ambre Laurène Simon and Louis tied the knot in 2011. Ambre and Louis have 1 child, named Ingrid.
Education Background:
Ambre completed her secondary education at Lycée Louis-le-Grand in 1993.
Ambre completed her university education at École Normale Supérieure (ENS) Paris in 2000.
Occupation History:
With a career spanning nearly 26 years, Ambre Laurène Simon has established herself as a key player in the industry.
In 1999, Ambre Laurène Simon started working as a Research Scientist at Ipsen S.A., marking the beginning of her successful career.
She then transitioned to Ipsen S.A. as a Clinical Trials Manager, leveraging her expertise to drive results from 2000 to 2002.
At Servier Laboratories, she worked as a Regulatory Affairs Director from 2004 to 2008, focusing on strategic initiatives and team collaboration.
She appointment as a CEO at Ipsen S.A. in 2010 marked a significant milestone in her career, as she took on increasingly complex challenges and delivered exceptional results.
She has been a Industry Leader at Pierre Fabre S.A. since 2014, consistently demonstrating her ability to adapt, innovate, and thrive in an ever-changing environment.
Wealth Summary:
She managed to save approximately 830000 EUR from her earnings at all companies.
She owns condo in Paris, where she resides. It is worth 1410000 EUR.


In addition to her career success, she also received an inheritance of 1360000 EUR from her late mother, a renowned Neurosurgeon, in 2012.
Client Summary: In summary, Ambre has demonstrated a strong work ethic and financial acumen, positioning them well for the future.
